text: Saran (; ) is a city in the Karaganda Region of Kazakhstan. It is located 15 kilometers from Karaganda, the center of the region. There are 34,636 people living in the city, and 43,816 people living in the urban area. ==History== In 1939, a village of geologists appeared on the place of the city. Geologists found coal in the area of the future city. Coal mining began during the Second World War. Along with coal mining, the village of Saran started to grow. On December 20, 1954, Saran received city status. ==References== Category:Cities and towns in Kazakhstan Category:Karaganda Region
title: Saran
